description: Borrowed from New Latin sternum, related to Old English steorn (“forehead”), German Stirn (“forehead”).

entries.meaning: (anatomy) The breastbone, consisting of the manubrium, gladiolus, and xiphoid process. [from 1660]
(arachnology) The sclerotized ventral plate of spiders, between the coxae, marking the floor of the cephalothorax.
